line_1: But talking is not always to converse,
line_2: Words learn'd by rote, a parrot may rehearse,

line_1: Oh! with this noble Sorcerer ne'er converse;
line_2: Or, soon he'll close thee in some high-plum'd hearse,

line_1: Because with me you can no more Converse,
line_2: No more repeat your wrongs, or tell me your distress,

line_1: With her would Nobles old converse,
line_2: And learn her dictates to rehearse,

line_1: With Homer, Virgil, Wieland, all converse
line_2: Like true compatriots in his pliant verse.
